Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lactocillin (XXJ; natural AMPs; UCSB; Cys-rich 54%; thiopeptide antibiotic, microbiome, bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature.Author: Donia MS, Cimermancic P, Schulze CJ, Wieland Brown LC, Martin J, Mitreva M, Clardy J, Linington RG, Fischbach MA. 2014
Literature.Title: A systematic analysis of biosynthetic gene clusters in the human microbiome reveals a common family of antibiotics

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (71.4%) toMicrococcin P1. Extensive post-translational modifications, involving both backbone and sidechain modifications, are involved to generate the final peptide form. See the ref for the structure. Active against Gram+ pathogens S. aureus (MIC 42 nM), E. faecalis (MIC 425 nM), C. aurimucosum (MIC 42 nM), G. vaginalis (MIC 212 nM), oral S. sobrinus (MIC 85 nM), S. mutans (MIC 425 nM), but not commensal vaginal bacteria.
